root.title: Deep Learning
root.content:
Deep Learning

A subfield of machine learning based on artificial neural networks with many layers (deep neural networks). It has led to breakthroughs in areas like computer vision and natural language processing.

quiz.question: What is the key characteristic of a 'deep' neural network?
options: It uses a special type of data

neural-networks.title: Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs)
neural-networks.content:
Artificial Neural Networks

Computing systems inspired by the biological neural networks that constitute animal brains. They consist of interconnected nodes (neurons) that process and transmit signals.

layers.title: Layers
layers.content:
Layers in a Neural Network

A typical ANN has an Input Layer (receives data), one or more Hidden Layers (perform computations), and an Output Layer (produces the result). Deep learning models have multiple hidden layers.

activation-functions.title: Activation Functions
activation-functions.content:
Activation Functions

A function applied to the output of a neuron that determines if it should be activated ('fire'). They introduce non-linearity into the network, allowing it to learn complex patterns. Common examples include ReLU, Sigmoid, and Tanh.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of an activation function?

cnn.title: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
cnn.content:
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)

A class of neural networks most commonly applied to analyze visual imagery. They use a special kind of layer called a convolutional layer that allows them to detect patterns like edges, textures, and shapes. They are the backbone of most computer vision systems.

quiz.question: CNNs are particularly effective for which type of data?

rnn.title: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
rnn.content:
Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)

A type of neural network well-suited for sequential data, like text or time series. They have 'memory' because their connections form a directed cycle, allowing information to persist. Variants like LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory) and GRU were developed to handle long-term dependencies more effectively.

quiz.question: What unique feature of RNNs makes them suitable for sequential data?
quiz.answer: Their internal memory or feedback loops

transformers.title: Transformers
transformers.content:
Transformer Architecture

A revolutionary neural network architecture introduced in 2017 that relies on a 'self-attention' mechanism. It processes entire sequences of data at once, making it highly parallelizable and effective. It has become the foundation for most state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs) like GPT.

quiz.question: What is the key mechanism behind the Transformer architecture?
